content: Wonderful adaptation of the board game. The interface is great and makes the game much more streamlined. Can't wait for the expansions!
Fantastic digital version of a great board game. Great way to learn the rules of the board game without reading pages of text. Animations and UI are terrific, I hope they bring this switch soon.

There should be an option to speed up/skip the animations as it takes forever. Might not be noticeable at first but on multiple replays it really gets annoying. Otherwise great adaptation of a great game.
Great alternative to playing the real thing. There's usually always a game open to join. No need to waste time setting up so you spend all your time playing!
Probably one of the best animated board games I've played on here!
previous issues have been fixed. still some minor rule mixups with WA alliance not getting cards when wiped through "favor of x". and would love to see the expansions
replyContent:
Hello Wilco!
If you are still encountering this issue, please drop us a line at support@direwolfdigital.com so that we can gather some more information and investigate further. Thank you so much!

content: Nice game, but the AI's preference for easy battles throws any tactical solo play to the wind as it will chase after Alliance sympathisers while letting whoever else is leading at the time build momentum forever. Meanwhile, Alliance AI doesn't vary its sympathiser placement, meaning if you're playing cat or bird against it and you keep one soldier on squashing duty it will keep reinstating them on the same spot forever, letting itself die in the progress. Also why Clockwork? Riverfolk, please.
Love the animation in this game. Love it!!!

I love the board game and playing on the go is fantastic. Worth the hefty price, though I wish the expansions weren't in app purchases, so I could play them with my kids and not spend a fortune. I hope the expansions come out as a free add-on.
Such a good game! Also, the developers have been doing an amazing job eliminating bugs and annoyances and improving the UI.
Wonderful for solo gaming or multiplayer matches. Beautiful translation of the Root board game to digital that minimizes bookkeeping and maximizes opportunities for strategic gameplay.
Riverfolk expansion when?
Great port of the boardgame. Can't wait for the expansions
Great game to play with friends and family, when you bring out more expansions, please make them free

Best board game app available. Challenging game that really feels like you are in a woodland encountering other creatures. I have found the AI great in learning how to play the game, and fairly difficult to beat. The clockwork automata expansion provides an additional challenge, and endless replay value. Essential for anyone who loves challenging strategic boardgames.
Incredible digital version of an incredible boardgame.

Fun to play, but a few mechanics that don't allow me to play my cards at right time or are hidden by 'turn log' and can't select. Also, Ambush cards!! How do you play these during or before sending a battle??
replyContent: Hello Mat! If you are still encountering an issue with hidden cards, please reach out to us at support@direwolfdigital.com so that we can get some more information and look into this for you. Thank you so much!

content: Exceptional implementation of the board game, will watch out for all future releases from Direwolf
Excellent, hope more expansions are planned :)
Love the game, worked great on my previous phone. On my new phone (Galaxy S20) I have to tap things several times before it registers. Makes it very difficult to play.
The best digital board game implementation out there. Amazing and highly replayable.

This is a great rendition of the board game. I do think that there is at least one rule that needs updating (defensive kills as the vagabond not turning hostile) And I can't for the life of me find out how to invite a friend to my game. HELP
replyContent: Hello Douglas! Glad to hear you are enjoying Root! If you are still experiencing issues with inviting friends, please drop us a line at support@direwolfdigital.com so that we can investigate further. Thank you so much!

content: Great, streamlined implementation of Root. Just needs the expansion factions to come alive!

Looks like it is probably an old excellent port of the boardgame it is based on, but if you don't already know how to play, the app is pretty weak. The tutorial fails to explain the majority of game concepts and the in-app rules book is vague and incomplete. Only way to play is to just guess and reverse engineer it by brute force playing repeatedly. To the developer: seriously, just put the actual board game's full rule book in-app and it would get more stars.
One of the best board games apps in existence

Excellent game. Good android version. I have both the Steam and Android versions and they are essentially identical as far as I can tell. I have had a few minor bugs, but nothing game breaking. Good game. Good adaptation. Good mobile version.
Loved the boardgame, can't stop playing and learning with the mobile version
My favorite Android board game port! Looks great and functions perfectly! A must have app!

A poorly adapted version of an amazing boardgame. If they had read the rulebook before making their app it would have gone much better. Don't waste your money. Devs are deleting negative reviews, so the rating is artificially high

I love root. I enjoy the app not such a big fan of the clock work expansion. But still a fun game and will continue playing it. Now I am hoping for the other expansions. As someone who played the board game(a few times) this really is a fun way to play when the game is not around.
10/10 game. Takes a bit to learn and tutorial is a bit shallow. Multilayer is a bit dead. Very addictive and fun. Will make you want to buy the board game.
replyContent: Thank you so much for the kind review! Have fun playing Root!

content: Poor implementation of a good game. Turns take too long. App is flakey and not quite polished yet for such a hefty price tag.
replyContent: Hello, If you are still experiencing issues with the application, please drop us a line at support@direwolfdigital.com so that we can gather some more information and create a fix for you. Thank you!

content: I keep having trouble playing online open 3min games. If another app interrupts gameplay - like I have a text or alarm and my screen switches apps - the Root screen becomes black and unresponsive. I have to restart the app, at which point I can no longer find the online game I was a part of. When I play password protected 3day games with friends, it works fine to close the app and come back later.
replyContent: Hello! If you are still encountering any of these issues, please reach out to support@direwolfdigital.com so that we can gather some more information from you and try to fix the issue. Thank you so much!

content: Tap area is a little bit off when fully zoomed out. And please provide option to turn of all animation to save battery life. And one where you can choose to play with icon only (like when zoomed out) will be very helpful.
replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for the feedback! This has been passed along to the team so we can take a look!

content: EDIT: Still kind of unplayable online, due to bugs with the Command Warrens, crafting, and notifications. Might revisit this if they ever get fixed, but since the game is still not playable months after launch, I can't give this a positive review. Good implementation, still a few discrepancies between the rules and the app, which make it less than great: the Marquise de Cat cannot choose which wood to use, and cannot usually use the field hospital immediately in other players' turns. The game also tells other players when you have an ambush card, which is not great. There should be two or three options in game setup - digital rules, tabletop rules, or even a compromise between the two where players set conditions for ambush and field hospital during their turn. Also seems to lack a way to view achievements, and could really benefit from an undo button and an option to have the Marquise de Cat always go first.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! There are some minor discrepancies between digital and physical rules, but we're listening to the community and looking for ways to improve gameplay -- feedback from experienced players is definitely appreciated. We do have an Undo function on the way in an upcoming update, so stay tuned, and thanks for supporting Root!

content: Beautiful game. However, I am having to press action buttons 3-4 times for it to work at times. Game stalls at times, forcing a hard quit, no save. Using Galaxy S20 phone.
Perfect, I would also give 10/10. This game will pave the way . Please make some profit and keep improving and supporting this great game.
Amazing game! I love the art! This is one of my favorie tabletop games, and now i can enjoy it on the go.

As a fan of the boardgame this is a great mobile/PC adaptation (I bought both) with sound design and animation which perfectly capture the original artwork. The game breaking bugs that were present at release have all been sorted now, there are few issues with notifications on 3 day games and there's no option to see the last turn of each game (surely the one you want to see most!). Looking forward to the expansion with the other factions!
replyContent: Hi Gaussian! Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts! We appreciate the feedback! When you run into these issues with 3-day turns, would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com with your device info and letting them know what is going on so we can take a look?

content: Dont bother wasting your money until they balance the game. Out of the 4 factions "vagabond" is overpowered and will win most of the games. Most people in the community complain about this and the few content creators share this concern. I had my review deleted twice now which represents the devs reluctance to correct this issue

Great underlying board game and graphics. Fairly frequent stability issues though many have been fixed. Currently hard to finish a multiplayer game without some players dropping out. Works well enough for async games with people you know. Five stars once it's possible to reliably complete games with random players.
Great game would love to see riverfolk and underworld expansion added

Game is great. Might wanna look into balancing the tincker plus favor cards...the combo is super powerful, not sure if it's intended or not. I got on Google Play can on play on steam as well? Or do I have to buy again?
Root is a truly incredible board game and the digital version really carries. The game play is solid and the developers are listening to player feedback.
Beautiful, well-done adaptation -- the only nit is that battle animations take way too long.
Easily the best board game of 2018, now in a wonderful app form. Can't wait for all the expansions to be added
Edit: games are stable now! Play away!
Yes! Excellent digital adaptation of a fantastic board game! Clockwork is great. Can't wait for the other expansions
Love this game, after playing my first game I immediately purchased the physical version. Though I wish there was a way to redeem the steam version with the mobile version, or even a reduced price.
Really? $6 for the clockwork expansion? In a game that already has AI? Perhaps you could work on asynchronous play, instead?
I Love war game.
Excellent digital version of the board game Root, packed with cute artwork and savage strategic woodland warfare.
Fun

I absolutely love this game, you need to actually talk with your opponents to negotiate and mess with them. The cats are perfect for your military plans, birds for the 5 steps ahead thinker, the alliance for your mental mind games, and your vagabond for the solo swindler/backstabber. One thing I wish we had the option to do would be to customize the deck, removing favor cards by choice you could allow people the chance to make it more homebrew like the physical game.
replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for your support of the game! We will pass this feedback along to the team so they can take a look. Have fun playing Root!

content: Zero technical or compatiability issues. Smooth UI. Fun gameplay with a lot of replay value as each faction has diffrent rules for play and diffrent stratigic ways of playing each faction. Great AI for solo play. Multiplayer runs smooth.
Great port. So glad I have it. Way to use and well made.
Great digital addition of a great game. I wish it were easier to find games however. Also hope the expansions are coming soon!!
replyContent: Hi Casey! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review, we appreciate the feedback! The first expansion, Clockwork Opponents, is coming Wednesday, November 18!!

content: This is a superb digital adaptation of the brilliant Root board game. The AI is quite adept and the challenge of mastering each faction is huge. The updates so far have helped to improve the overall function and performance of the app AND a particularly nice touch is when you zoom out fully, it goes from the amazing animated version to looking like the tabletop version - very nice! Worth every cent. Hopefully they do the expansions as well.
replyContent: Hi Jessica! Thanks so much for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review, we are so happy to hear you are enjoying Root!! The first expansion, Clockwork Opponents, is coming Wednesday, November 18!! :)

content: EDIT: Love the implementation, game is great and very smooth. Understand Clockwork Expansion is in the works - very much looking forward to that and also, hopefully, expansion factions!
replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts! We are happy to hear the recent patch fixed the online play issues you were experiencing! If you run into any problems drop to support@direwolfdigital.com! We are working towards the first expansion to include Clockwork Opponents in a future update. Keep an eye out! :)

content: I'm a big fan of the board game! And I want to love this app, but so far I don't. It's got a lot of good things going for it, but at the same time it's a little rough. And is it just me, because I somehow end up with zero in EVERY roll! That's not fun.
replyContent: Hi there! Sorry to hear you aren't enjoying Root! We love player feedback and want to hear your thoughts, feel free to drop a line via in-game feedback or to support@direwolfdigital.com!

content: Great adaptation. Is there any chance for the expansions?
replyContent: Hi there! Thanks for leaving such a kind review! The first expansion, Clockwork Opponents, will be coming to Root on Wednesday, November 18!

content: Great digital version of a great boardgame. The animation is great. The AI will use strategies I have seen often used in the tabletop game. I am looking forward to the expansions and additional maps getting added in the future.
I'm a big fan of the board game and the app is great to sharpen your skill if you can't play with someone. I really, really wish that they release the expansions soon!
replyContent: Hi there! Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback! We are working on the Clockwork expansion now!

content: Great game, gorgeous app, and bugs are getting squashed getting the support it needs! Adding friends is still not intuitive and notifications are wonky but clearly care has been put in and excited to see this app grow.
replyContent: Hi Dakota! Sorry to hear you are having trouble with Root - would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com and letting us know what you are having trouble with so we can take a look?

content: Waiting for the expansion
replyContent: Hi there! Thanks for the four stars! We are working on the Clockwork expansion now!

content: This is a solid adaptation of the board game. The tutorial could use a little tweaking however. Not a lot of things are explained well and after completing all the tutorials I still had several questions. I love the challenge mode. It is a fun alternative to the standard game with fun extras that make a game harder or even easier. I'm looking forward to the expansions being added into the game. Hopefully we get all the new factions, maps, and decks from the physical game!! Great work devs!!!
replyContent: Hi Tristan! Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts, we are super happy to hear you are enjoying Root! If you wanted to share some of your questions with us, feel free to drop a line to support@direwolfdigital.com and we will take a look! We always appreciate player thoughts while working to make our games the best they can be!

content: Great

I would like to leave a 5-star rating, but the most recent update has destroyed the game's functionality. I cannot get it to download all necessary content on opening the app. Very frustrating! It just hangs; then I get an error message stating that required files didn't download. Hoping you can find a fix!
replyContent: Hi there! Sorry to hear you are running into issues after the most recent update. Would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com with screenshots and your device info so we can take a look?

content: Game runs fine enough, but the AIs are terrible, thereby making any solo play boring. There is also some GUI issues where you have to press buttons multiple times before they actually function.
replyContent: Hi there! Sorry to hear you are having trouble with some of the features in Root. Would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com so we can see what is going on?

content: Great adaptation of my favorite board game!
Lots of bugs. But great initial design.
replyContent: Hi Chris! Sorry to hear you are having issues with Root. Would you mind dropping a line via the in-game feedback function or to support@direwolfdigital.com when you encounter a bug so we can see what's going on?

content: This is the best digital port of a board game ever. Root may not be everyone's cup of tea from a game mechanics perspective (i love it) but this is a faithful rendition while taking advantage of the strengths of a mobile UI. Also the devs made the wise decision to have a 3 day and a 3 minute move option for multiplayer. That some games don't do this is beyond stupid. Looking at you Scythe. Direwolf digital needs to give themselves a pat on the back for this one. Now! Expaaaaaaansions pleeeeease!

Great game. Plays really well, although we've had a few glitches with games freezing. It's there any information on how the leaderboard works? We were trying to work it out. Can this be explained somewhere please?

The Art and basic game play is great. Playing games vs the AI in a single go works fine! The online experience needs work. Getting back into the game after a break often hangs or is way to slow. If you buy it for the single player or want to support the developer, go for it! If you expect a first class online gaming experience, you better hold off a while or skip this one. Edit: Still needs work, but the latest update did make tmit way more stable for me.
replyContent: Hi Harald! Thanks so much for taking the time to share your thoughts, we appreciate the feedback! If you continue running into issues with the online gameplay, would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com so we can take a look?

content: Many bugs that need to be fixed...
replyContent: Hi Stephano! Sorry to hear you are running into issues with Root. If you haven't done so yet, would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com with your device info and the bugs you are running into so we can take a look?

content: It's good, but desperately needs the expansion factions.
replyContent: Hi Adrian! Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts! We are working towards the first expansion to include Clockwork Opponents in a future update. Keep an eye out! :)

content: A sensitive riff on the exceptional presentation of the boardgame, with a sincere digital art translation, empathic musical composition and surging animation choreography that builds pacing and immersion. However, the stilted AI, half baked Challenge Mode, shoddy UI, poor presentation of pertinent information and extended (and often completely unnecessary) combat cut animations really hamper the title. Expectantly hoping that the developers respond positively, given their obvious good intent.
replyContent: Hi Fred! Thanks so much for taking the time to share your thoughts, we deeply appreciate the feedback and take player suggestions to heart when working towards making Root the best it can be! If you have any additional feedback, feel free to share it at support@direwolfdigital.com!

content: Love the game but it has some discrepancies with the actual board game rules. For example, while playing as the Eyrie, I went into turmoil because I could not recruit (it was a bird card so I could have recruited at any roost) because I maxed out my number of wartiors, but when the AI plays the Eyrie, they can recruit as many as they want. It's annoying to see them recruit massive numbers of troops that in a real game they could not field!
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! There are some minor discrepancies between digital and physical rules, but we're listening to the community and looking for ways to improve gameplay -- feedback from experienced players is definitely appreciated.

content: Great implementation of a unique and engaging boardgame. Best with human opponents, but some of the single player challenges are solid for learning the games varied mechanics. A few bugs but reassured by seeing how active the devs are in communicating and patching
replyContent: Hi James! Thanks so much for taking the time to share your thoughts! We are really happy to hear you are enjoying Root! We are working towards making it the best game it can be, but if you run into any issues feel free to drop a line via the in-game feedback function or to support@direwolfdigital.com!

content: Definitely requires polishing with some annoying bugs, like in online gaming or constant claiming of dominance card instead of crafting when you play for Alliance. But in general provides a great experience. Can wait for riverfolks and underworld expansions release. When it's planned?
replyContent: Hi Nikita! Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. When you run into this issue again, would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com so we can take a look?

content: Best app I've ever seen
replyContent: Hi Carter! Thank you so much for your kind words, we are so thrilled to hear you are enjoying Root!

content: What an achievement! Fantastic implementation of a game I haven't been able to get ahold of physically. My only complaint is that I'd love an option to skip the battle animations. Everything else is perfect. Haven't played multiplayer yet, though. Hoping the expansions will find their way in here, even if it's a DLC.
replyContent: Hi Sam! Thank you so much for your kind words, we are absolutely thrilled you are enjoying Root! There is an option to skip battle animations now implemented in the game! If you have any other feedback, feel free to let us know!! :)

content: Single player and GUI is good, but you can never finish a multiplayer game since it crashes halfway through. Very frustrating. If you don't care about multiplayer, it's a good game. Otherwise, avoid.
replyContent: Hi Rich! Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback, we are so sorry to hear you are having trouble with online functions in Root. Would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com so we can take a look?

content: This is a superb digital adaptation of a superlative board game.
replyContent: Hi there! Thanks so much for taking the time to share your thoughts - we are so happy to hear you are enjoying Root!

content: Loving this implementation, I've been dying to play Root since Direwolf announced the digital version. My one negative comment so far is that after minimising the game I get a black screen on relaunch. I have to close the app and reload it each time.
replyContent: Hi Emmett! Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts - we are so happy to hear you are enjoying Root! Sorry to hear there is a bit of trouble relaunching the app. We have been made aware of this issue and are working towards a fix!

content: Great game, great graphics! 3m games a a bit buggy on Android, if I tab to another app for a few min I can't log back in for like 20min and get kicked from the game... But manageable and still fun to play, 5 stars after a few bug fixes.
replyContent: Hi Alan! We are so happy to hear you are enjoying Root! Sorry to hear you are having trouble switching between applications, would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com with your device info so we can take a look?

content: Game hangs often. Also button presses don't always register. Hard to recommend in its current state. Feels broken. Also the AI continually targets WA making it impossible to revolt unless you draw an Ambush card.
replyContent: Hi James! Sorry to hear you are running into issues with Root! Would you mind dropping a line to support@direwolfdigital.com with your device info so we can take a look?

content: Good game but terrible stability and optimization. Edit: This was finally fixed, but I could never finish the game and it's still an issue. It crashed during a 3m game and now it says "failed to load match" I am locked from online play. I cant even log in. I tried to clear cache and reinstall. Please fix or refund asap.
replyContent: Hi Pedro! Sorry to hear you've encountered this issue while playing Root! We chatted via support and believe this issue has been corrected, but if it occurs again please drop a line to support@direwolfdigital.com!

content: I love all things Root, so being able to play by myself whenever is really a step up. Online can be wonky, but give it time. In the mean time, play locally. It really ups your abily and allows you to try things that you normally wouldn't in person. My only real question is: when is the Riverfolk Company going to be available? That is what I am most excited about. Keep it up.
Good adaptation of a great board game. Would get 5 stars but it sometimes is a little finicky when clicking buttons and it could really use an action log. Otherwise, great implementation!
This is one of the best board game apps that I've played. The game really comes alive and is fun to play.
Exceptionally well made game
For 10$ it really shouldn't be this buggy. Constantly dropping games, crashing etc.

I own the physical board game, but the app really made me appreciate the game so much more. Being able to pick up and play the game at any time with people let's you get to know the factions so much better; something that may be more difficult for players who only own the physical copy. If you own the board I definitely recommend the app, but if you're new to the game the app is a great way to get your feet wet on one of the top rated board games ever.
Terrific!
The vagabond suffers three hits when the Woodland Alliance revolts? Where is that in the rules?

There are a few adjustments that could be made. The games interface reveals certain things about your hand, such as when you have an ambush card or when the cats have bird cards. Change of rules for the Keep really hurts the Marquise. The ingame chat system needs some form of notification Overall, it is a great adaption and I look forward to the eventual expansion support.
I hope the expansions gets to be added in the digital version soon

Love the boardgame. Love that I can play whenever I like! A.I. is ok, not great, but bettet than the bots with the real game. Rules seem to be spot on. Controls seem a little clunky but you get used to them. It's a board game so you need great control anyway. LOVE the music. Art is a good representation of the game.
Game breaking glitching are too common. So far all of my games have been cut short from it. Also, the lack of an undo button is unforgivable for a game with this man rules.

Overall fun, but very frustrated by aspects of the game. Really needs an undo button. I go to craft something sometimes and instead of crafting I'm supposedly trading in for a dominance card I did not want.
Well implemented and absolutely worth the price. Havent come across any bugs. Anybody who knows the actual board game wont be dissapointed.

love Kyle's art! looking forward to expansions already!! the main thing holding back my fifth star is that the medium AI birds seem to be really extra passive. an aggression slider would be nice, but once they even walked directly away from what would have stopped my Dominance win. they really need is self preservation. another more minor thing came up last game while fighting on the Keep: the cats used Field Hospital four times in a row. it could happen, i guess, but it was suspicious.

If you are considering getting this game becauae 1. You like Root/asymmetrical game, 2. You want a play a good war gameish digital board game, 3. Get that one game that rewards you for playing more. ***Note to Dire Wolf Digital Staffs*** 1. Many times I have to press play button(continue button) multiple times to get it to work. 2. Frequently Woodland Alliance's craft button functions as "discard for claiming dominance card". 3. I really wish zoom out function was more responsive and smooth...

More than half of my games stuck while in battle, unable to resolve the battle and resume the game. It happened intermittently when your opponent is required to choose a card to use in battle while being attacked
Good game, almost great app, but needs an undo button

It has fatal bugs. If they fix them I will update this review, because the game itself is truly a masterpiece, the animation superb, the stylistic choices completely on point. You just can't finish a game. Of the 15 or so games I've started with friends thus far, maybe 9 or 10 have glitched out and refused to let us continue them. We will enter combat and two x's will appear on the dice (and some random number of characters will die on either side) and thats it, but the fighting never resolves.

I really want to come back and edit this into a positive review someday soon, but this app is pretty buggy and extremely frustrating vis a vis UI. First, I've been in four online matches, of which one is permanently stuck in the middle of a battle for all players and another of which just completely disappeared while starting up. Second, there's no option to undo actions that don't create die rolls and/or trigger opponents' abilities. There's more to dislike but reviews are limited to 500 chrs.
Awesome game. Cant wait for expansion factions and maps.
Superb, how long for the expansions.
Fantastic, would love to see expansions added as DLC to buy
Excellent adaptation

I accidentallyeft an online game in the midst of playing with my friends, that are telling me in still in game wherelse I can't locate or get back in to that game (just a note for others who may fall into my problem, maybe don't have the leave game option untill the results are out could be better.) also on another 3 minute timer game, I alt tabbed and could not get in that game at all. I'm stuck in entering "Online Game" forever. I think am at a dead end please help.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you ran into trouble! Please drop us a line at Support@DireWolfDigital.com so we can take a look and see how we can help!

content: So far the online play has been very frustrating. I created a game with a 3 minute timer but tabbed out of the game to find there was no way to get back in right away. Second attempt I create a 3 day turn game, leave while I wait for friend to join since there is no way to invite. He joins and then the game is gone for the both of us in both online games active and browser tabs. Take notes from through the ages, that app does online play right.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you ran into trouble! Please drop us a line at Support@DireWolfDigital.com so we can take a look and see how we can help!

content: Love the game. Online play is super janky
replyContent: Sorry to hear you ran into trouble! Please drop us a line at Support@DireWolfDigital.com so we can take a look and see how we can help!

content: Very good adaptation of board game. Great support from Dire Wolf Digital if you have any issues.

Makes you want to buy the physical copy of the game. Wish they port the expansions too. It is a meaty game that makes you think. It will take a while to learn to play every faction but the learning is fun on itself. Lots of replay ability. This is the most expensive app I bought, yet it is completely worth it.
Never played the boardgame, but strongly considering buying it based on the strength of this digital version.
Unable to download on Samsung Galaxy so that was $10 for, quite literally, nothing. Yay.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you ran into trouble! Please drop us a line at Support@DireWolfDigital.com so we can take a look and see how we can help!

content: Finally a way to play this fantastic game digitally on the go.
Great digital adaptation. If you like the board game get this!

Amazing game! Slight learning curve, but the tutorials explain everything. After a few games, everything comes together and I've really come to appreciate how beautifully designed this game is! It amazes me that each player plays so drastically different, but the game is still well balanced
Probably the best asymmetrical board game to date. Now available on electronic devices.

What a great adaptation of a fantastic board game. I can't speak to how helpful the tutorial is if you don't already know how to play the board game, but the game itself is phenomenal and feels very much like the board game. Money well spent! Here's hoping for the expansions!!!
Love the game but it could really use a ping system too any players going afk during match
Great implementation of an awesome game. I was wondering do you plan to implement the extensions as in the original game?

One of the very best digital translations of a boardgame I've ever played. Super smooth animations, easy to touch & identify screen icons and even allows for "play and pass" multiplayer. 5 stars all around.
One of the best digital adaptations of a board game I've ever played
